events.message: The claimant reported a car collision that occurred on May 9th involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection.
After review, the incident was categorised under Auto Accident due to reported vehicle damage and collision details.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the claimant’s auto accident case to ensure timely processing.
Claimant received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and is currently under review.
The claimant was requested to submit a copy of the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and medical bills related to the accident.
All requested documents including police report and damage photos were submitted by the claimant for further processing.
An investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and evidence to assess liability and damages.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and the vehicle damages were fully verified.
A settlement amount covering repair costs and medical expenses was proposed to the claimant for approval.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the clear communication and fair settlement offer provided by the agent.
Following acceptance of the terms by the claimant, the auto accident claim was officially approved by the claims department.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the claimant’s account to cover vehicle repairs and medical bills.
The claim case was closed successfully after payment issuance and final confirmation from the claimant.
All claim details and documents were archived in the system for future reference and regulatory compliance.
